doc.after: The word castle is derived from the Latin word castellum which is a diminutive of the word castrum meaning fortified place The Old English castel Old French castel or chastel French ch teau Spanish castillo Italian castello and a number of words in other languages also derive from castellum 1 The word castle was introduced into English shortly before the Norman Conquest to denote this type of building which was then new to England 2
